channel.title: Configuration on GDG
channel.description: Recent content in Configuration on GDG

item.title: Structure
item.description: GDG Configuration is based on a YAML configuration. It also has the option to override configuration values via environmental variables.

item.title: Globals
item.description: Global flags are configuration that applies to all contexts. The following flags are all nested under globals: Clear Output clear_output when set to true will remove all files in the destination folder prior to importing the data.

item.title: Storage
item.description: This is only needed if you intend to use a cloud provider to store your backups. If you are downloading your backups to your local file system you can skip this section.

item.title: Contexts
item.description: Contexts define a connection to grafana and how to interact with it, authenticate, how to map the connection credentials, how users are created etc.

item.title: Debugging
item.description: Debugging / Trouble shooting There are two configuration flags that can be very useful to determine the issue. ... global: debug: true api_debug: true The debug flag enables very logging which may provide some insight on the core issue that you’re running into.

item.title: Legacy
item.description: Configuration This is mostly left for reference to older documentation patterns for previous versions. Connection Connection Credentials Version v0.4.2-v0.5.1 Legacy Behavior Preview behavior did not support the use of a secure/secureData.
